summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, notifying them of the Government's intent to introduce certain exhibits and call a witness at trial. The witness is described as a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein who is expected to testify about scheduling sexualized massages for Epstein with underage girls.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, recipient of the government's notification letter.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein

persons.name: Damian Williams
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed the letter.

connections.description: Maxwell is on trial for crimes related to Epstein's sexual abuse of minors; the government's evidence pertains to their alleged joint criminal activity.
Everdell is listed as defense counsel receiving the government's notification on behalf of Maxwell.
Menninger is listed as defense counsel receiving the government's notification on behalf of Maxwell.
Pagliuca is listed as defense counsel receiving the government's notification on behalf of Maxwell.
Sternheim is listed as defense counsel receiving the government's notification on behalf of Maxwell.
The government's anticipated witness is described as a person who 'was employed by Jeffrey Epstein'.
The witness is expected to testify about activities (scheduling massages) central to the charges against Maxwell, implying a professional or conspiratorial connection.

events.title: Government Trial Evidence Notification
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office notifies Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team of its intent to introduce specific exhibits (GX 401-404, 409-410, 413) and call a witness at her upcoming trial.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the case, governing the confidentiality of materials like this notification letter.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza (likely the U.S. Attorney's Office building)
keyFacts: The government plans to call a witness who was employed by Jeffrey Epstein and is expected to testify about 'scheduling sexualized massages for Jeffrey Epstein with underage girls.'
The government intends to introduce exhibits GX 401 through 404, GX 409 through 410, and GX 413 as direct evidence of the crimes charged against Ghislaine Maxwell.
The evidence is also offered under Rule 404(b) to prove Maxwell's intent, plan, knowledge, identity, or absence of mistake.
The document is governed by a protective order dated July 31, 2020, and is itself designated as 'confidential'.
The identity of the key witness referenced in the letter is redacted in the provided text.
